title: mozilla not connecting to quick books for batch email. single emails work s fine.
content:
during our change to dual work stations we have been attempting to send our email batches for billings. the last batch sent that worked was in december. come january end the batch was sent out but did not connect to mozilla. all invoices must be sent as one by one instead of the authorize email and click once to send to mozilla.

the secondary system is unable to run email at all because of the provider restriction. we load to pc for email. quick books is run from pc not of internet server service. I am assuming that during settup and dabling on the new work station I have manipulated a setting and now there is an inconsistancey. I just can't seam to find it. PC1 has always had the primary position of email and batch creation. PC2 is with out direct email in or out since it all on PC1.

What is my check procedure. Mozilla does not have a record of receiving batch email, quick books says it was sent out to mozilla.
creator: herbsalign

title: Zpožděný příjem pošty
content: Dobrý den, ve firmě již delší dobu používáme program Thunderbird a v min. měsíci jsme obměňovali NTB, což znamenalo nové nainstalovaní programu a import stávajících účtů. Možná to bylo i neprovedenou aktualizací, ale od té doby, když si zasíláme/přeposíláme emaily mezi sebou ve firmě, došlá pošta se instantně neobjeví u příjemce jako v minulosti. Co jsem odpozoroval, byla prodleva snad 10 min než se nová pošta v doručených objevila. Tak jsem pátral v nastavení a narazil jsem v nastavení účtu -> Nastavení serveru -> Kontrolovat nové zprávy každých 1+ min (defaultně bylo nastaveno zmíněných 10 min). Aji když toto pole odkliknu, tak nová zpráva se mi zobrazí pouze když kliknu na doručenou poštu nebo daný emailový účet a dám Přijmou zprávy. Kde v nastavení prosím nastavím, aby se mi doručené zprávy zobrazili instantně nebo s maximálně pár sek. zpožděním? Toto zpožděné zobrazení doručeným zpráv mi moc nedává smysl. Děkuji s pozdravem Červinka
creator: adoss2

title: Cancelling emails after hitting send
content:
Just started using Thunderbird. I notice a feature which I really like, the ability to cancel an email after hitting send. today I tried it for the first time. But the email still sent and shows in sent folder.

What is the purpose of that cancel button, if it doesn't work? Also, is there a known time period where you have to be quick enough to hit cancel for it to work!?
creator: mozilla516

title: Global activation of alert sounds (reminder) for upcoming events possible?
content:
Hi lads,

I used TB for many years but only now started using it in office. I have a problem with the calendar function however which I have to use now. I'd like to have an audio alert and/or window pop-up forcing interaction for any event in my calendar, let's say 15 min ahead. I tend to overlook the small notification pop-ups in the bottom right corner of the screen since they also vanish automatically after a few seconds.

I can get these small bottom right corner pop-ups to appear for any event by using the global notification preferences in the Edit Calender options. However, I can not globally activate an audio alert or a window requiring interaction for upcoming events. I can just activate a reminder manually for each and every event, which is a lot of work, naturally. So, is there a way to activate a reminder (not a notification, which is the bottom right pop up I assume) globally for any event in a calendar?

Can also be done by an add-on or by manually changing source files, if anyone has suggestions in this direction.

Thanks in advance, trashmaster
creator: trashmaster

title: Thunderbird Calendar
content:
Having finally got fed up with all the adds in Outlook.com, I've now started using Thunderbird as my email client! (I know, what took me so long?!) I've set up my email ok and it all seems to be working fine and syncing with my Outlook.com account, but I have some queries regarding the Calendar. I've managed to add my Outlook.com calendar to Thunderbird, but; 1 - How do I sync my Thunderbird calendar with my Outlook.com calendar? 

    At the moment any changes/additions I make aren't synced.

2 - Also, someone shares their calendar (Outlook.com) with me. 

     How do I add and sync this to my Thunderbird calendar.

Although I love my tech etc, I'm only good with what I know, so please explain any solutions as clearly and simply as you can, sorry! Regards Mark
creator: Mark62
